nodes.title: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS)
nodes.desc: A security feature implemented in web browsers to prevent web pages from making requests to a different origin (domain, protocol, or port) than the one the web page was loaded from. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CORS)

nodes.title: HTTP Request
nodes.desc: A request sent by a client, such as a web browser, to a server to retrieve or modify data. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Methods)

nodes.title: Proxy Server
nodes.desc: A server that acts as an intermediary between a client and a server to bypass CORS restrictions. [More Info](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/cdn/glossary/reverse-proxy/)

nodes.title: CORS Proxy
nodes.desc: A server that acts as an intermediary between a client and a server to bypass CORS restrictions. [More Info](https://github.com/Rob--W/cors-anywhere)

nodes.title: Web Storage
nodes.desc: A mechanism for storing data locally in a web browser. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Web_Storage_API)

nodes.title: IndexedDB
nodes.desc: A low-level API for storing structured data in a web browser. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IndexedDB_API)

nodes.title: WebSockets
nodes.desc: A protocol for establishing a persistent, low-latency communication channel between a client and a server. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebSockets_API)

nodes.title: Fetch API
nodes.desc: A modern API for making HTTP requests in web browsers. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Fetch_API)

nodes.title: XMLHttpRequest
nodes.desc: A legacy API for making HTTP requests in web browsers. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/XMLHttpRequest)

nodes.title: HTTP Response
nodes.desc: A response sent by a server to a client in response to an HTTP request. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status)

nodes.title: Origin
nodes.desc: The domain, protocol, and port of a URL. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/Same-origin_policy)

nodes.title: Same-Origin Policy
nodes.desc: A security policy implemented in web browsers to prevent web pages from making requests to a different origin than the one the web page was loaded from. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/Same-origin_policy)

nodes.title: Preflight Request
nodes.desc: An HTTP request sent by a browser before making a cross-origin request to check if the server allows the request. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CORS#Preflighted_requests)

nodes.title: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
nodes.desc: A response header sent by a server to specify which origins are allowed to access the resource. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Access-Control-Allow-Origin)

nodes.title: Access-Control-Allow-Methods
nodes.desc: A response header sent by a server to specify which HTTP methods are allowed for cross-origin requests. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Access-Control-Allow-Methods)

nodes.title: Access-Control-Allow-Headers
nodes.desc: A response header sent by a server to specify which headers are allowed for cross-origin requests. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Access-Control-Allow-Headers)

nodes.title: JSONP (JSON with Padding)
nodes.desc: A technique used to bypass the same-origin policy by wrapping JSON data in a JavaScript function. [More Info](https://www.w3schools.com/json/jsonp.asp)
